title: Macron and Mélenchon both trivialize the far right
summary: Jean-Luc Mélenchon has said that Jordan Bardella is 'Macron, only worse.' Emmanuel Macron has put the far-right and Mélenchon's La France Insoumise party on equal footing. Both arguments only trivialize the far-right party, and might even strengthen it.

title: 'Given the RN's stances on Russia, there would be a real security problem in the event of cohabitation'
summary: François Heisbourg, a security and defense specialist, tells Le Monde that a far-right victory in France's parliamentary elections would raise serious security issues, particularly on international issues.

title: French elections: Bardella's fluctuating and tricky-to-implement policies
summary: The far-right leader laid out his first priorities should he be appointed prime minister after parliamentary elections on June 30 and July 7.

title: French elections: Far-right ally Ciotti disowns candidate for 'anti-Semitic, homophobic' comments
summary: Eric Ciotti said he no longer supported Louis-Joseph Gannat, who confirmed he was behind a deleted X account that published such comments.

title: French elections: Far-right RN disowns candidate over anti-Semitic post
summary: Rassemblement National withdrew support for Joseph Martin, who in a post on social media in 2018 said 'gas did justice to the victims of the Holocaust.'

title: Macron accused of transphobia over criticism of left-wing alliance policy
summary: The French president on Tuesday criticized a proposal allowing citizens to change their gender at the town hall.

title: Rape and anti-Semitic insults: What investigators have pieced together from 12-year-old girl's assault
summary: On Tuesday, three teenagers were charged after they violently assaulted a girl in the Paris suburb of Courbevoie on Saturday.

title: Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un consolidate an openly military alliance
summary: The Russian president, who was welcomed with great fanfare in Pyongyang, and the North Korean leader signed a comprehensive strategic partnership treaty which 'provides, among other things, for mutual assistance in the event of aggression.'

title: Death toll from heat at hajj pilgrimage in Saudi Arabia passes 900
summary: Temperatures hit 51.8°C in Mecca, Islam's holiest city, on Monday, as 1.8 million people took part in the annual pilgrimage.

title: Euro 2024: Musiala shines as Germany qualifies for last 16
summary: The hosts beat Hungary 2-0 in their second group-stage match.

title: Louisiana requires classrooms to display Ten Commandments
summary: Opponents say they will challenge the law in court, while supporters claim the message also has historical significance. Classrooms will be required to display the posters by next year.

title: Two women go on trial for claiming French first lady is transgender
summary: Online rumors have suggested that Brigitte Macron has never existed, with conspiracy theorists claiming that the current first lady's brother Jean-Michel had changed gender and assumed that identity.

title: Collective-run Paris cinema La Clef saved from closure
summary: After several years of struggle, the La Clef Revival cooperative has succeeded in buying back the historic site in the Latin Quarter. It will reopen in June 2025.

title: French senators urge end to Russian LNG imports and creation of TotalEnergies 'special share'
summary: An investigating committee in the conservative-dominated chamber of Parliament recommended the French state to get a 'special share' in the oil and gas giant to influence its strategic decisions.

title: Carlos Tavares' ruthless cost-cutting strategy
summary: Already a champion of low-cost management, the CEO of Stellantis wants 80% of his purchases to come from low-cost countries by 2028 to boost his profitability and stock price. He refuses to consider the political impact of the resulting job losses.

title: Paris 2024: Olympic venues are almost ready for the Games
summary: Concorde, Invalides, the Eiffel Tower, the Trocadéro: Construction is nearing completion on these sites, setting up the various temporary facilities that will host the Olympic Games in Paris this summer.

title: Biden eases citizenship pathway for 500,000 undocumented spouses of Americans
summary: At the beginning of June, the American president restricted migrants' ability to apply for asylum. This time, his latest measure aims to reassure the left wing of his party.

title: European Commission reprimands France and six countries for breaking budget rules
summary: The European Union's executive arm is considering opening 'excessive deficit procedures' against Belgium, France, Hungary, Italy, Malta, Poland, and Slovakia.

title: Euro 2024: Broken-nosed Mbappé partially trains ahead of Netherlands match
summary: Kylian Mbappé appeared with bandages on his nose at France's training session, where he worked on specific exercises with a physio.

title: US destroys two Houthi sites in Yemen
summary: The group has been attacking vessels in the Red Sea in a show of solidarity with Palestinians, drawing the ire of Western supporters of Israel.

title: Water war rages on in Delhi, crushed by a historic heatwave
summary: India's overcrowded capital is no longer able to serve all its neighborhoods, especially the slums, through its dilapidated network. The informal tanker water distribution business is booming.

title: Power returns to Ecuador after hours-long nationwide blackout
summary: The country suffered blackouts in April when a major drought left key hydroelectric reservoirs nearly depleted.

title: Covid-19: increased viral circulation boosted by new KP.2 sub-variant
summary: This sub-variant, derived from JN.1, is more immune-evasive but doesn’t cause more severe forms of the disease.
